ygData.messageBody:
On Thu, 13 May 1999, McCartney, Michael R wrote:

> Its a good thing you're here to tell us all exactly how Verant programmed EQ. ...its also good to know that there is no way possible that it could've been a bug. I'd hate to thing that all the little bugs in the game right now, were all real. I'm sure now that they are all made up and that Verant would not program the game to have bugs in it. Thank you so much for your well thought out response.

Okay, first of all, let's all relax and take a deep breath.

...

Now that our minds are clear, here is what I have noticed.
If you find it displeasing, please choose to ignore it.

I have found that skill increases (as well as many things)
are very "streaky". I rarely have a skill increase one
point and then not increase again for a long time. I usually
get my skill increases in bunches of 3 or 4, actually.
On the flip side of this, the times between these "good"
streaks are marked with very long times of "bad" streaks.

I would tend to agree to the theory that you had a
particularly unlucky "streak" before you logged out
and then logged back in. But that's just me.
Then again, maybe Verant programmed in a good day / bad day
routine that determined how good a day you would have when
you log in. I find the thought rather amusing, but ...
